required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of CP-751,871 in Combination With Carboplatin and Paclitaxel in Advanced Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1, Dose Escalation Study of CP-751,871 in Combination With Carboplatin and Paclitaxel in Previously Untreated Patients With Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: Investigate safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of CP-751,871 when given in combination with carboplatin and paclitaxel in patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLT)
primary_outcome.description: A DLT was defined as any one of the following adverse events observed in Cycle 1 which was considered as related to CP-751,871 combination therapy; 1) >=Grade 3 gastrointestinal toxicity, hyperglycemia and/or fatigue despite the use of adequate/optimal medical intervention, 2) Any other >=Grade 3 toxicity not classified under CTCAE blood/bone marrow, or 3) Grade 4 neutropenia that persisted for >=7 consecutive days or was complicated by fever (defined as a body temperature >38.0 Celsius degree), 4) Grade 3 thrombocytopenia which needed blood transfusion or Grade 4 thrombocytopenia.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycles 1 and 4 at prior to dosing of CP-751,871 (Day 1), and 1, 24, 72 and 168 (Day 8) hours after end of CP-751,871 infusion
Cycle 1 : prior to CP-751,871 (Day 1) dosing, and 1, 24, 72 and 168 (Day 8) hours after end of CP-751,871 infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma decay half-life is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by one half.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time 0 to Day 22 (AUC0-day22)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: prior CP-751,871 (Day 1) to dosing, and 1, 24, 72 and 168 (Day 8) hours after end of CP-751,871 infusion
secondary_outcome.description: AUC(0-day22) : AUC from time zero (Day 1) to Day 22, where Day 22 is the nominal time (504 hours) of the predose sampling for the next cycle. AUC(0-day22) was calculated using the linear/log trapezoidal method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Curve From Time Zero to Tau (AUCtau)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 4: prior to CP-751,871 (Day 1) dosing , and 1, 24, 72 and 168 (Day 8) hours after end of CP-751,871 infusion
secondary_outcome.description: AUCtau: AUC from time zero to tau, the dosing interval, where tau is the actual time of the predose sampling for the next cycle. AUCtau was calculated using the linear/log trapezoidal method.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 and Cycle 4: prior to CP-751,871 (Day 1) dosing, and 1, 24, 72 and 168 (Day 8) hours after end of CP-751,871 infusion
secondary_outcome.description: The ratio of Cycle 4 AUCtau to Cycle 1 AUCtau

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Concentrations of Total Insulin-like Growth Factor 1 (IGF-1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycles 1 to 6, Day 8 of Cycles 1 to 4, and end of study
secondary_outcome.description: IGF-1 is one of the IGF-axis related biomarkers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Concentrations of Total Insulin-like Growth Factor Binding Protein-3 (IGF-BP-3)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycles 1-6, Day 8 of Cycles 1-4, and end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: IGF-BP3 is one of the IGF-axis related biomarkers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Positive Anti-Drug Antibody (ADA) Specific to CP-751,871 Following an Intravenous Infusion of CP-751,871.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycles 1 (predose) and 4, and end of study
secondary_outcome.description: The screening assay for anti-CP-751,871 antibodies was performed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Objective Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 6 cycles (1 cycle = 21 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with objective response based on assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to RECIST. Confirmed CR defined as disappearance of all target lesions. Confirmed PR defined as ≥30% decrease in sum of the longest dimensions (LD) of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum LD according to RECIST. Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging study ≥4 weeks after initial documentation of response.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 6 cycles (1 cycle = 21 days)
secondary_outcome.description: PFS is the period from the registration to the first documentation of objective tumor progression or to death due to any cause, whichever occurs first.

intervention.description: Chemotherapy (carboplatin and paclitaxel) and CP-751,871 (6, 10 or 20mg/kg) will be administered by intravenous infusion every three weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of advanced non-small cell lung cancer
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0 or 1
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any prior treatment for non-small cell lung cancer
- Brain metastases
- With diabetes

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

clinical_study.keyword: CP-751,871, Non-small cell lung cancer, Phase 1

group.title: CP-751,871 6 mg/kg in Combination With Chemotherapy Agents
group.description: CP-751,871 6 mg/kg was administered intravenously on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle in combination with following chemotherapy; paclitaxel 200 mg/m^2 was administered intravenously over 3 hours, then carboplatin AUC 6 was administered intravenously over 30 minutes or longer prior to the CP-751,871 infusion. Study treatment was repeated up to 4 cycles, unless disease progression or unacceptable toxicity was observed, and then up to 6 cycles if the participant showed response or stable disease at the end of Cycle 4 and agreed on additional treatment.

group.title: CP-751,871 10 mg/kg in Combination With Chemotherapy Agents

Study treatment was repeated up to 4 cycles, unless disease progression or unacceptable toxicity was observed, and then up to 6 cycles if the participant showed response or stable disease at the end of Cycle 4 and agreed on additional treatment.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: ECOG Performance Status
measure.description: ECOG = Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group. ECOG Grade: 0: Fully active. 1: Ambulatory, carry out work of a light or sedentary nature. 2: Ambulatory, capable of all selfcare. 3: Capable of limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours. 4: Completely disabled, no selfcare, totally confined to bed or chair. 5: Dead.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLT)
outcome.description: A DLT was defined as any one of the following adverse events observed in Cycle 1 which was considered as related to CP-751,871 combination therapy; 1) >=Grade 3 gastrointestinal toxicity, hyperglycemia and/or fatigue despite the use of adequate/optimal medical intervention, 2) Any other >=Grade 3 toxicity not classified under CTCAE blood/bone marrow, or 3) Grade 4 neutropenia that persisted for >=7 consecutive days or was complicated by fever (defined as a body temperature >38.0 Celsius degree), 4) Grade 3 thrombocytopenia which needed blood transfusion or Grade 4 thrombocytopenia.
outcome.population: DLT Evaluation Set comprised of participants who were treated with CP-751,871. One participant in the 10 mg/kg cohort who discontinued from the study due to an adverse event occurred prior to CP-751,871 administration was excluded from this analysis set.

group.title: CP-751,871 6 mg/kg in Combination With Chemotherapy Agents
group.description: CP-751,871 6 mg/kg was administered intravenously on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle in combination with following chemotherapy; paclitaxel 200 mg/m^2 was administered intravenously over 3 hours, then carboplatin AUC 6 was administered intravenously over 30 minutes or longer prior to the CP-751,871 infusion. Study treatment was repeated up to 4 cycles, unless disease progression or unacceptable toxicity was observed, and then up to 6 cycles if the participant showed response or stable disease at the end of Cycle 4 and agreed on additional treatment.

Study treatment was repeated up to 4 cycles, unless disease progression or unacceptable toxicity was observed, and then up to 6 cycles if the participant showed response or stable disease at the end of Cycle 4 and agreed on additional treatment.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Positive Anti-Drug Antibody (ADA) Specific to CP-751,871 Following an Intravenous Infusion of CP-751,871.
measure.description: The screening assay for anti-CP-751,871 antibodies was performed.
measure.population: All participants were screened for the ADA.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Objective Response
outcome.description: Number of participants with objective response based on assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to RECIST. Confirmed CR defined as disappearance of all target lesions. Confirmed PR defined as ≥30% decrease in sum of the longest dimensions (LD) of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum LD according to RECIST. Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging study ≥4 weeks after initial documentation of response.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 6 cycles (1 cycle = 21 days)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) was defined as all participants who met all of the following criteria; 1) Those who were diagnosed with NSCLC, 2) Those who received at least one dose of the study treatment, and 3) Those who had efficacy data after the start of the study treatment.

Study treatment was repeated up to 4 cycles, unless disease progression or unacceptable toxicity was observed, and then up to 6 cycles if the participant showed response or stable disease at the end of Cycle 4 and agreed on additional treatment.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Objective Response
measure.description: Number of participants with objective response based on assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to RECIST. Confirmed CR defined as disappearance of all target lesions. Confirmed PR defined as ≥30% decrease in sum of the longest dimensions (LD) of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum LD according to RECIST. Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging study ≥4 weeks after initial documentation of response.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) was defined as all participants who met all of the following criteria; 1) Those who were diagnosed with NSCLC, 2) Those who received at least one dose of the study treatment, and 3) Those who had efficacy data after the start of the study treatment.

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: PFS is the period from the registration to the first documentation of objective tumor progression or to death due to any cause, whichever occurs first.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 6 cycles (1 cycle = 21 days)
outcome.population: Number of participants with defined event (all causality death or PD) was too few to conduct summary analysis.

reported_events.time_frame: For serious adverse events, up to 150 days after the last administration of the study drugs
reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and an SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
